comment: This professor is by far one of the best teachers I've had at this university. Professor Jackson is a very different and non-traditional teacher. I think that these reviews are bad because the things we discuss in class are heavy, some people aren't mature enough to handle this. Jackson doesn't just teach, they practice it outside of school as well

Very political class, however did cover interesting topics. Very unorganized, offered extra credit but not doable if you have a busy schedule. Never knew what my grade was through the entire course. She does not believe in rubrics so good luck writing the papers. Always agree with her or else. However, she does know the course material very well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: One quiz every week based off of the textbook. You will not pass the class if you do not read the book, but it is doable it is one chapter per week. There is an extra credit opportunity at the end of the semester. She does not take late work. There are a couple discussion board posts. Your post has to be 500 words and your response has to be 250.

She secretly makes changes grading guidelines for papers a few days before its due. Ive had 2 papers where she changed the topic we where to write on and/or how the paper will be graded literally days before its due. Her critique of your work is whether she agrees. I hated that the text book for this course reads like a chapter book.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Pretty bad, seems to give randomly low grades with very little reasoning. I would not take this professor. This class is just taking quizzes from the book, doing an occasional discussion post (250 words), and an essay or 2. Again, the grading seems very random to me with no clear rubrics given. She clearly doesn't put time into the class.

I recommend that everyone steer clear of this professor. If you are interested in this course, do yourself a favor and take it with another professor who is more open minded. You would think that the person teaching this course is open to discussion, however if your views do no align then she gets angry.

The most substantial advice I can give is to accept some of the content at face value even if you disagree. A few points made by the text seem like blanket-statements or arguably close-minded, but the content in this class doesn't really have black/white answers, which can be weird to accept. Not a biggest fan of the quiz questions either.

Be ready to have an open mind. Most of her lectures are class discussions. Also, be ready to type, write, and work hard. She will toughly grade your essays, but it is for you to improve your writing which really does help. Critical reading is a huge part of passing this class, so be ready to read and take notes. Great Professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Amazing lectures

comment: Jackson is all around just a terribly poor professor. She is an extremely tough grader & talks bad about her online students with her in person class students. If you have an opinion she does not like, prepare to fail because everything offends her. The groupme for the class was really just an outlet to complain about her bc she is that bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: As everyone else seemed to think, we all thought this class was an easy A and it is not. The first few quizzes are really hard, but after that they are pretty straight forward and easy. Her discussions are fairly simple, but they do take reading the material. I did one extra credit assignment and made a 60.. and I really tried. Is not an easy A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you enjoy vague (projects, tests), take her. There is a lot of reading involved but there isn't much substance to the class. Her grading is very biased, as well, based more on her understanding. I could not find an equal ground with her. Taking her class, I almost lost interest in gender studies. I would rather quit college than take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not the best professor I had. Took her online class and was awful. Her quizzes were hard and it was pretty much self taught. Made you question what you know about the subject. Wouldn't recommend her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Jackson is a really great professor. Her class may cause debates and be confusing, but she makes you think about issues that one wouldn't.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Jackson is very one-sided when it comes to her class, but she is a great professor. She provides a lot of insight to many issues people don't even think about. If you disagree with her, it may ruin your chances at a good grade. Overall, I would recommend taking her class.
